Package entities.trees

Class TDP_Star_Equijoin_Instance

  • java.lang.Object
    • entities.trees.TDP_Problem_Instance
      • entities.trees.TDP_Star_Equijoin_Instance
  • public class TDP_Star_Equijoin_Instance
extends TDP_Problem_Instance
    A class for Î¤-DP problems that are equi-join star queries: A star query of size l involves one parent relation R1 and l-1 other relations hanging off of it. R1 has l-1 attributes and Ri joins with the (i-1)'th attribute of R1. All other relations are binary. (see Star_Equijoin_Query). The goal of T-DP is to find the minimum total weight of a query result. Inside this class it is safe to downcast TDP_State_Node.state_info to Tuple (except the starting_state).
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis

    • Method Detail

      • bottom_up

        public void bottom_up()
        Description copied from class: TDP_Problem_Instance
        The bottom-up phase of T-DP creates a T-DP state/node for each tuple. Every relation maps to a stage of T-DP. The starting node is artificial and the terminal nodes are implicit (To avoid the unnecessary overhead, we omit the terminal nodes). The cost of transitioning to a tuple is the cost of that tuple. After the bottom-up phase, the optimal cost is the minimum achievable cost from starting_node. The optimal (top-1) solution can be reconstructed by going top-down and following best decisions.
        Specified by:
        bottom_up in class TDP_Problem_Instance

      • hash_stage

        private HashMap<Double,​List<TDP_State_Node>> hash_stage​(List<TDP_State_Node> stage,
                                                              int join_attribute)
        Hashes the nodes of a particular stage of T-DP. The key is one of the attributes of the associated tuples that will be used for the join.
        Parameters:
        stage - The stage to be hashed.
        join_attribute - The index of the attribute that will be used as the key.
        Returns:
        HashMap>

        public static void main​(String[] args)
